head.title: A Primary Dash, Not a Marathon

hedline.hl1: A Primary Dash, Not a Marathon

block.p: With the Iowa caucuses just weeks away, the chairmen of the Republican and Democratic parties say they are bracing for a presidential primary season so unexpectedly competitive that they have to reach back to 1960 for a comparison.

With the Iowa caucuses just weeks away, the chairmen of the Republican and Democratic parties say they are bracing for a presidential primary season so unexpectedly competitive that they have to reach back to 1960 for a comparison.

Yet the entire exercise may be over soon after the public begins to pay attention. This will be the speediest dash to the nomination ever because several states, seeking greater political sway, have moved up the dates of their contests. State of the Campaign: Last article of a series. Page 22.
